intro: Persoonia mollis subsp. caleyi, commonly known as the slender silky pear, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to Western Australia and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and silky, pale green foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and sandplain areas. This subspecies is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its unique foliage and floral display.
